reviews.text: Pasaje De La Paz is a picturesque street. It is not huge, but narrow with older style buildings. The architecture, actually is quite interesting, with some archways and paintings on the walls. There are a few shops around, with outdoor sitting too. Worth a short visit.

This small street is located in the Barri Gotic district. It can be hard to find.

The most famous brothel in the city was located on this street.

This short passage way goes from Joseph Anselm Clave Street to Joaquin Xirau Square  in the Gothic area and has some history. For a start the spelling in Spanish is incorrect and has a 'g'and not a 'j' which apparently is quite rare. It all came about in the second half of the 19th century when spelling was not seen as important as today. Reading about this  place it also has had some interesting businesses as inhabitants.This is an interesting and pretty part of the Gothioc Area and this one of those places you find by walking these old narrow streets..
